description: As a participant of the II call of 'Adopta un Junior', I collaborated in a cross-functional team, developing a web application for creating reminders that are sent to email, called CaLEANdar. The application was developed using Astro, with CSS and JavaScript on the frontend, and Firebase services on the backend, including Google account authentication, a real-time database, and Cloud Functions for alerts and reminder creation.

Contributed to the Mozilla - PerfCompare open source project as an Outreachy 2023 internship applicant. Implemented UI/UX design updates for the Perfcompare tool interface, navigating an existing codebase to deliver text and size adjustments, a new button, background image integration, and a dark mode toggle. Technologies: React, TypeScript, JavaScript, Material UI, Git, GitHub.

As an Outreachy 2023 internship applicant, I contributed to the JupyterHub open source project. Evaluated JupyterHub's web accessibility using the WAVE tool, documenting accessibility issues and proposing solutions. Developed and integrated a pytest plugin, creating a fixture and running some tests within the JupyterHub project. Technologies: Python, Web Accessibility, Git, GitHub, CSS, HTML.

Scheduling and conducting progress review meetings for approximately 180 projects submitted by companies from different sectors such as: health, technology, agriculture and tourism. At each meeting the companies provided me with updates on their activities and potential problems they were encountering in the development of each project. In addition to serving as a liaison between the projects and the audit team, I also had to communicate the status of the projects, facilitating proactive problem solving.

Create training content for public sector employees on information security auditing ISO 27001:2013, as part of an initiative funded by Colciencias.  Responsibilities included researching the standard and relevant Colombian laws, creating course content (including practical exercises) and setting up the course on a Moodle e-learning platform.  I also obtained the ISO 27001:2013 Internal Auditor certification during this project.

I collaborated in a cross-functional team (developers, requirement analyst) to developed a software solutions for regional credit cooperatives, focus on asset management and best practices.  Led a six-person development team, implementing Scrum methodology (daily stand-ups, sprint planning). Responsibilities also included performe administrative tasks, documentation (user manuals), and reporting to management.

As a Requirements Analyst for a company developing betting platform software, I collaborated with stakeholders to gather and translate business needs into detailed software requirements. Translated these requirements into UML diagrams and use cases using Enterprise Architect.  Developed and presented interactive prototypes, facilitating clear communication and ensuring a shared understanding of application functionality.

role: Administrator of the Version Control System
description: Responsible for source code version control across the entire application lifecycle (development, testing, and production).  I used Spring Tools IDE with TortoiseSVN to maintain the repository, incorporating all developer code changes. I also had to coordinate with the Infrastructure team to deploy updated files to servers, ensuring seamless releases.
